title: Vegan’s anger at being served ham on Domino’s ‘plant-based’ pizza
text:
Patrick Hukins says he fell ill shortly after eating the pizza (Picture: Patrick Hukins)

A vegan says he is furious with Domino’s after being served with real ham on a ‘plant based pizza’.

Patrick Hukins, from Sydney, says he felt sick to his stomach after eating the pizza and has been ‘betrayed’.

He had ordered lunch from his local Domino’s on Monday, but noticed something was wrong as soon as he started to eat the pizza.

The childcare worker, who has been a vegan for four years, says not eating animals is a core part of his belief system.

He added that he felt ‘incredibly guilty’ because it went against his attempts to also reduce his environmental footprint, Daily Mail Australia reported.

Mr Hukins says he contacted Domino’s straight away, but was repeatedly assured that it was ‘not real ham’.

He claims that the company initially refused to apologise and backed the position taken by its employees, even though he provided pictures showing them the ham on the pizza.

The plant based pizza which contained ‘real ham’ (Picture: Patrick Hukins)

Patrick Hukins has been a vegan for four years (Picture: Patrick Hukins)

Domino’s says it works hard to deliver meals that meet customers’ requirements (Picture: Domino’s)

A Domino’s spokesperson later apologised to Mr Hukins, and described the incident as an ‘inadvertent mistake which would be used as a learning opportunity’.

The spokesperson added: ‘Domino’s has a 100 per cent customer satisfaction guarantee, and each of our team members works hard to deliver meals that meet our customers’ requirements, including specific dietary needs.

‘We have specific procedures in place for customers with vegan or allergen requirements, including using fresh gloves and cutting blades for their order.

‘Because of these procedures, we have received positive feedback from customers on our vegan range.’
